title: 'The next-door landlord won't let me investigate a leak. What are my rights?'
text:
Every week, the Telegraph’s Property Doctors bring expertise on renovations and DIY, interiors, buying and selling, lettings, legal issues and taxes – addressing three topics. Send your questions to propertydoctors@telegraph.co.uk

Legal issues

Q My daughter bought her garden flat five years ago. The layout had been altered before she moved in. There is a party wall and after a while it became apparent it was very damp.

Our guess is that there was an existing problem but it was disguised in order to sell the house. The mortgage survey didn’t pick this up. There are now signs of damp extending across the party wall and spreading across the floor.
